quest.name: A Blessed Instrument
journal: Alphinaud draws you close with a whisper.
objectives: Deliver the list of the singer's symptoms and the chunk of meol to Thoarich in the Derelicts.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (Lady Chai has a very particular sense of beauty, and apparently that extends to how I should dress whilst painting...)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (But this obsession of hers works in our favor. The time I spend indulging these distractions is time you can use to continue your explorations.)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (For this excursion, I'd like you to delve into the layer below us, and sniff about the military headquarters. I'm sure the Understory has its own tale to tell...)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (Now is your chance to squeeze in another round of reconnaissance. Go─I will cover your absence should the Chais become suspicious.)

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: <sob> <sniff>

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: You...you're one of the bonded, aren't you? Like me?

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: Please, I need your help! My throat, it's... I can't sing anymore...

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: I've been making excuses, but it's just not getting any better. If my patron thinks I'm of no use to him, then... <sob>

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: I need you to sneak out to the Derelicts and describe my condition to Thoarich.

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: Here's a list of symptoms, and a hunk of meol to pay for his medicines... Please, I have no one else to turn to!

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: ...You don't know the Derelicts? It's the mess of shacks and ships right outside Joyous Hall.

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: That's where the apothecary lives. Or at least, that's what I heard...

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: Hee hee! You need medicines? Tonics? Potions?

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: Hmmm, a cure for an ailing voice, is it...?

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: No, no medicine will cure this. Methinks your songbird has a lump in her throat. It must be cut out, excised, and even then the voice may never heal completely.

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: Hee hee, poor little songbird. Will they kick her from the nest, I wonder? Or simply silence her chirps?

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: Hoho, your face! You didn't know!? Of the many hopefuls who enter the city, very few are ever seen to leave. Even as corpses...

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: Oh, you might see one or two fortunate fools hurled from the balconies, but the rest...? Gone.

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: A town of nightmares, it is. Not for this ship's rat, oh no no. I am content to scurry around down here, and nibble on the crumbs which fall from the table.

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: This consultation is over! You have my verdict, and I have my meol! Good day!

dialogue.name: THOARICH
dialogue.text: All the old hands, they know, oh yes, they know. They just don't like to talk about it. Wouldn't want to upset the status quo, hee hee!

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: D-Did you get my medicine...?

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: <sob> ...So that's it? What am I to do if I can't sing...?

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are, my sweet canary. Have you been crying again? Don't tell me your voice is still not on the mend...

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: Oh, generous sir, have mercy! I've done all I can, but even the apothecary said...

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: ...So you've been suffering all this time?

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: I am sorry, my pet. I hadn't realized your affliction was this grave... But you needn't fret! I'll not reward your hours of trilling by casting you out into the street!

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: You are too kind, sir...

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: But what use am I if I cannot sing? I fear the day I become more burden to you than treasure...

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: Then I shall have a word with Lord Vauthry, and arrange for your ascension.

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: In that paradise where resides neither pain nor illness will your song ring out clearly once again.

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: ...Or mayhap you think it a step too far?

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: No, I... You would do that for me!?

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: Of course. Why, I would almost wish to hasten my own ascension, knowing your blessed instrument was waiting there to greet me.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ascension...?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Sounds too good to be true...

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be a new arrival. Allow me to explain.

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be a new arrival to harbor such doubts. Allow me to allay your suspicions...

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: As all know, the sin eaters exist to devour the sinful. But also do they serve to gather the souls of the innocent, and shepherd them unto celestial paradise.

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: It is through Lord Vauthry that we learned this truth. It is through Lord Vauthry's grace that the free people of Eulmore are destined to embrace salvation.

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: We are blessed to spend our days surrounded by love and merriment, until at last we are called to our final rapture. Even the bonded may find a place within that host, should their patrons deem them worthy.

dialogue.name: SINGER03289
dialogue.text: Lord Vauthry truly is a great man, isn't he?

dialogue.name: GENTLEMAN03289
dialogue.text: Now if you will excuse us, we must be on our way. May you find eternal salvation for the compassion you have shown my precious canary.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, dearest, we really should have found you some new gloves.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Yes, my love, you're probably right...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis good to see you back. You were taking so long I began to worry something had happened.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I've begun sketching an outline for the portrait, but...nay, the Chais appear otherwise occupied. Will you share what your investigations have gleaned thus far?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So...Lord Vauthry boasts some manner of influence over the sin eaters, does he? That would explain the reverence in which he is held by the citizenry.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And as for this “ascension” business, I cannot help but be put in mind of that apothecary and his ominous remarks. If so many folk have entered the city over the years, then where do they go...?
